intro: Neobartsia sericea, commonly known as silverleaf bartsia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, silvery hairs. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or partially shaded woodland areas. Neobartsia sericea is an herbaceous perennial that blooms from late spring to early summer.
